chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon M. Glidden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).
  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include: Sex Offender.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
  May not have contact with minors, victims or their residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Life long sex offender registry.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Count 2 and Consecutive to Counts 1 & 3.

Attorney Mike Graveley appears on behalf of the Plaintiff State of Wisconsin along with Atty Jennifer Phan. Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court with Defendant Jon M. Glidden who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU 
  Minutes:  Sworn in and testified is DE's witness:  Angel K.  Exhibit 2 re-offered and received.  Atty Singleton requests sequestration of witnesses and requests Atty Phan be removed from counsels table.  Upon hearing arguments sequestration of witnesses is granted.  Parties stipulate to Exhibit 5 which has been offered and received.  DE's witness:  Atty Gary George is sworn in and testified. Exhibits 6 and 7 are received.  Atty Phan is sworn in and testified.  Defense rests.  Atty Singleton requests parties brief closing arguments and Atty Graveley states his objection.  Court grants request and Atty Singleton shall brief his argument by 8/26/22 and the State shall file their brief 9/09/22.  Court will render a written decision in September.

09:01 AM Defendant Jon M. Glidden appeared in custody by video; Attorney Justin L. Singleton appeared on behalf of the Defendant by video. Attorney Michael David Graveley and Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the Prosecution by video.  Clerk N. Nobile.  Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing is being held via video conferencing.
MINUTES: Matter heard with 16CF947. Discussion held regarding amount of time needed for evidentiary hearing and possible dates. Attorney Singleton requesting that the prior trial counsel appear by zoom for the evidentiary hearing. The State objects to request. Prior trial attorney will appear in person for next hearing. The State will prepare an order to produce for the defendant and submit the order to the Court.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 09:00 am in Room 124 of the Kenosha County Courthouse.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney G George.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statement from Natalie G.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 12 years WSP:  8 years initial confinement w/credit for 187 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 3 the court imposes a total sentence of 12 years WSP, concurrent to ct 1:  8 years initial confinement w/credit for 187 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 12 years WSP, consecutive to cts 1 & 3:  8 years initial confinement; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 4 the court imposes a total sentence of 12 years WSP, concurrent to ct 2 and consecutive to cts 1 & 3:  8 years initial confinement; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 5 the court imposes a total sentence of 13 years WSP, consecutive to cts 1, 2, 3 & 4:  8 years initial confinement; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $1,250.00 DNA surcharge.  No contact with minors unless otherwise approved by the agent, no contact with victims or their residences.  Bond motion to be filed.

Glidden is granted a continuing stay of appellate review of his petition for leave to appeal pending production and filing of the June 30, 2015 hearing transcript.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Glidden is granted leave to file an amended petition, which shall be filed within ten days of the filing of the June 30, 2105 transcript. Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney G George.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State's other acts motion.  Atty George requests to wait for court of appeals ruling prior to proceeding w/motion.  ADA Phan requests to proceed w/motion today.  Court proceeds w/other acts motion.  Atty George moves for sequestration.  Court denies request for sequestration at this time.  Court allows other acts concerning H.M., does not allow other acts concerning M.C.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

Dated 6/25/15 IT IS ORDERED that the Defendant-Petitioner Jon M. Glidden is granted leave to amend his petition.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Glidden shall file his amended petition within ten days of the filing of the transcript.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Plaintiff-Respondent the State is granted an extension of time, retroactive to June 16, 2015, in which to file its response to Glidden's petition for leave to appeal.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the State shall file its response within ten days of the filing of Glidden's amended petition.
